Name: Trivial Pursuit: Auvergne
Description:
The famous trivia game.

The questions are about the French region of Auvergne.

There are 3000 questions in 6 different themes; History, Geographie, Science and Nature, Art and Literature, Entertainment and Sports and Leisure.

Name: Monopoly: Ariège – Libres comme l'Air
Description:
Monopoly: Ariège – Libres comme l'Air invites you to travel in Ariège. 
By playing, with family or friends, you will progress from town to village, from plains to valleys and discover the exceptional landscapes of the Pyrenees. An ideal setting for practicing outdoor activities, summer and winter. Let yourself be seduced by a remarkable natural heritage, browse 14,000 years of history from cro-magnon to the present day through the Cathar castles, Ariege will have no secrets for you.

With the Ariège Monopoly, play to buy the properties of the department of Ariège between friends or family.

Build houses and hotels will allow you to win a maximum of rents during the game to be able to win it. At auctions, negotiate with your opponents to win the bet at the best price and acquire the most goods. It will take risks and be the smartest to win the game!

Name: Hand2Hand
Description:
You’re in the enemy’s hide-out, they vastly outnumber you and your cover has been blown! There’s no other option, but to fight your way out using your Kung-Fu skills.

In Hand2Hand you play as one of two Kung-Fu crime fighters, using your martial art skills to neutralise the enemy threat.

The game is played until either one player is hit by an enemy (they lose), or the players knock out 18 enemies (the player’s win).

The game is played over several rounds. In each round a D6 is rolled to determine where the new enemies spawn. The players then select, in private, which new action card to play.

Once the round has been setup, the players can discuss the sequence of actions to play. The main restriction is that the actions must be taken alternatively (left player, right player, left player, etc.). There are other restrictions, such as:
• a player can only perform up to 2 actions per round,
• an action may only be used once,
• the targeted enemy must be adjacent to the action card,
• actions cost cubes, meaning some actions prevent a player from taking a second action.

The key point is that few of the actions let you directly knock-out an enemy, you must use the enemies’ attacks against each other. There are three types of enemy:

• Unarmed enemies cannot knock-out (discard) another enemy, they can only knock-down (flip over),
• Knife Wielding enemies can knock-out any enemy,
• Gun Wielding enemies can knock-out any enemy, but they cannot be blocked (placing a cube on the enemy card), and some player actions cannot be used on them.

-description from designer

Name: Rendezvous over Triton
Description:
Dear sirs,

as loyal servants of Her Majesty Queen Victoria XII’s Ministry for Celestial Affairs, you are hereby invited to invest in the HMRS (Her Majesty’s Rocket Ship) Endeavour, the latest exploration vessel designed to impress the values and spirit of the British Empire on the peoples of the solar system.

In Rendezvous over Triton you traverse the solar system brokering deals between planets and moon to better your own finances. The aim of the game is to be the aristocrat who invests the most in the HMRS Endeavour.

The aim of the game is to have the most money invested in HMRS Endeavour. The game is played in turns. Each turn the player draws two, double sided location cards and then places them in sequence from the current location card. The player choose the order and the side of the placement in order to optimise the actions they want to activate. Then as the ship travels from the current location to the next location the matched actions are executed.

Actions include:
• Gathering Intelligence. This is used to active black market actions.
• Training. This is used to improve actions you execute.
• Strike a Deal. This is used to increase your money.
• Invest in the Rocket. This is how you win the game.

Instead of executing the matched actions, you can spend the intelligence you have gathered to execute a black market action. These allow you to spoil another player’s deal, improve your own deal, or to cash out of a deal early. The cost of executing a black market action is that the location banishes the Endeavour from its orbit.

The game ends when 1 player has an undefeatable investment in HMRS Endeavour.

-description from designer

Name: Monopoly: Elf
Description:
“Son of a nutcracker!” Fans of the classic holiday film Elf will be tickled pink as they travel down memory lane in this re-imagined version of Monopoly. With iconic characters, locations, and quotes, Christmas cheer will sure be sung loud for all to hear in MONOPOLY: Elf.

Components:
Game Board
6 Collectible Tokens: Santa’s Sleigh, Polar Bear Cub, Jack-in-the-Box, Mailroom Coffee Mug, Santa’s Bag, Maple Syrup
28 Title Deed Cards
16 Community Chest Cards renamed Christmas Cheer
16 Chance Cards renamed Christmas Spirit
32 Houses renamed Apartments
12 Hotels renamed Skyscrapers
2 Dice
Rules

-description from publisher

Name: Monopoly: City of Syracuse
Description:
Our city of Syracuse (NY) is enjoying a revitalization of downtown businesses and living while continuing to provide world-class education and medical services to this great community. The creation of this authentic custom Monopoly board quickly took on a life of its own. The result is a pride piece showcasing our beloved city for all the people, places, businesses, organizations, cuisine, events and "Syracuse-isms" that are unique and special.

Your purchasing has helped feed hungry children, families and seniors in our community by supporting Food Bank of Central New York.

As you play this game with your friends and family, we hope you smile as you journey back to all the things that will always make Syracuse so special.

description from the back of the box

Name: Seed
Description:
In SEED, you will work your little plot of land, trying to grow as many seeds as you can so they can be protected from extinction for future generations.

Each turn, one card tells the players where they can take actions on their field represented by a 4x4 grid.
Players can Dig, Sow, Irrigate, Harvest (placing or replacing the corresponding action pieces) or Save (scoring Seed Points). Once all players have taken their actions, a new field card is revealed and a new turn starts.
The game ends when the deck runs out of cards for the second time and the player with the most Seed Point is the winner!

Seed includes Cooperative and Solo modes plus 3 mini-modules: Granny Tips, The Weather and The Rocks.

Name: Arcmage: Enchanted Realm
Description:
The second core set of our libre fantasy style strategic card game Arcmage.

As you battle your opponents summoning creatures and casting spells, you’ll have to defend your cities, manage your resources and power supply and conjure up a strategical plan to beat your opponents. Will you be the one that brings order to the warring factions in Irdiya? Will you challenge all and utter the words ‘Amin duna, ilya lanta’?

This turn based game allows a player to gather resources, build cities, cast and move creatures, recruit an army, play magic spells or interrupt an opponents' play. Each turn the player may launch an attack on an a target city. On opponents' turns players may have to bravely defend their cities against the marauding enemy's army. Lose all of your cities and you're out of the game.

Following the tradition of many great CCG's, the game supports both casual as in depth strategic game play. Furthermore it offers an unique resource system and adds a spacial dimension that lets the player decide how and where to deploy their creatures.

—description from the publisher

Name: CH35S: The Seca'linus expansion
Description:
This expansion adds a new army to play in the far-future war game of CH35S.

The Seca'linus are an army of rebels that have thrown off their shackles of slavery to the Knightmare Empire and now seek to find weaknesses to the galaxy's oppressors.

Included in this YMOR set is a new army record, tokens to represent your new army on the battlefield and a new solo-play scenario to test your army against.

—description from the publisher

Name: Set a Watch: The Few & Cursed Promos
Description:
Additional 4 Unhallowed cards and 1 Location card based on The Few & Cursed graphic novel for use in Set a Watch.

Included as part of The Few and Cursed: Deluxe Expansion and as a stretch goal for the Set a Watch: Swords of the Coin Kickstarter.
Families: Series: Set a Watch (Rock Manor Games)

Name: Arcmage: New Horizons
Description:
The thrid core set of our libre fantasy style strategic card game Arcmage.

As you battle your opponents summoning creatures and casting spells, you’ll have to defend your cities, manage your resources and power supply and conjure up a strategical plan to beat your opponents. Will you be the one that brings order to the warring factions in Irdiya? Will you challenge all and utter the words ‘Amin duna, ilya lanta’?

This turn based game allows a player to gather resources, build cities, cast and move creatures, recruit an army, play magic spells or interrupt an opponents' play. Each turn the player may launch an attack on an a target city. On opponents' turns players may have to bravely defend their cities against the marauding enemy's army. Lose all of your cities and you're out of the game.

Following the tradition of many great CCG's, the game supports both casual as in depth strategic game play. Furthermore it offers an unique resource system and adds a spacial dimension that lets the player decide how and where to deploy their creatures.

—description from the publisher

Name: Mystic Vale: Evergreen
Description:
The Evergreen micro-expansion adds new advancement and vale cards to the base Mystic Vale game, giving players more card crafting power. Conclaves for Twilight Garden and Harmony expansions grant players the option to customize the starting decks of advancements and vales, creating a new play experience each game.

This will be available direct from AEG.

—description from the publisher

Name: BattleCON: Dolores Solo Fighter
Description:
Dolores’s wide-reaching attacks combine with the frightful power of the Wings of Malephaise, which allow her to move quickly around the board. Though her ranges are limited, her superior mobility and disruptive potential allow her to create deadly situations for her opponents.

Confound and corner your opponents to strike them down!

Name: Roll-Z
Description:
Will you survive? Roll-Z is a Solo Survival Time Challenge, in Print and Play format, but with colorfull high definition PDF files, and that's not all! You will need the Oficial Game Aplication that not only complements game immersion, with chilling original music, sounds and graphics, it also enhance the gameplay WITH RANDOM ENCOUNTERS making it a REAL TIME CHALLENGE.

In Roll-Z you represent a survivor who must find pieces to fix the car, place them, and at the same time repel a horde of zombies trying to tear down your fragile barricade. Is not easy! If you manage to repair the old Chevy (by putting together the 5 necessary pieces) before time runs out, you have won, but if your barricade collapses or you run out of time, you will became another brainless wobblers.
TO SURVIVE, you will need to master all the resources of the game, from zombies to trash. With an easy to learn mechanic, and a deep fast paced tactic options, you get a replayable surviving game to play with all your friends. Challenge them all!

—description from the designer

Name: Das Elbespiel
Description:
The players travel from Dresden via Lobositz, Leitmeritz and Coswig to Dessau and back to Dresden. Movement is determined by a die. On some stations events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to arrive back in Dresden wins the Game.

The game was published for the 100th anniversary of commercial steamship tours on the river "Elbe".

—user summary

Name: Les Naufrageurs
Description:
Les naufrageurs is a game inspired by the legends or realities of the island of Oléron based on the looting of wrecked boats, authorized by the king, in bygone days.

Shipowners are trying to save their cargo (barrels of different values, kept secret from Naufrageurs until captured, if captured).
Shipowners assign barrels to each boat.
Les Naufrageurs d'Oléron (land pirates of Oléron) try to make ships beach and capture as much booty as possible.
Points are counted once the barrels  have been used up.
Whoever got the most wins.

The game used homemade 3-sided "dice".

Name: Posthuman Saga: The Journey Home Expansion
Description:
In your quest to scope out the slave camps, you’ve gone deep into the mutant heartland, further than anyone from the Resistance has been in years. You’ve seen cruelty, horrors and tragedies that will stay with you for the rest of your days. It’s time to let your path take you back home, to the Fortress. It’ll be a long, eventful journey, taking you through uncharted territories. Along the way, you’ll have plenty of occasions to gather intel for the Resistance, help out strangers and allies you meet, strike another crucial blow or two in the war against the mutants, and garner even more renown before you walk back through the Fortress’ gates.

Posthuman Saga: The Journey Home adds several new mechanics and more alternate ways of scoring to the base game. Enjoy Posthuman as it was always intended, with more player interaction, evolving narrative missions and a heavier tactical experience.

The Journey Home also adds a lot of new content - pick from 2 new playable characters, recruit new followers, collect more weapons and equipment and fight your way through a nasty bunch of new mutants.

-description from publisher

Name: UkeSeme!: 2nd Expansion Card Set "Chaos Hen"
Description: This expansion pack adds 40 more cards to the original game. The theme on this expansion is chaotic personality characters, such as con men, mobsters, evil gods, and more.

Name: UkeSeme!: 1st Expansion Card Set "Iromono Hen"
Description: This is an expansion pack for the original UkeSeme! game that adds 40 new cards to the game. The new cards are various "ã‚¤ãƒ­ãƒ¢ãƒŽ" (Iromono, a slang term for characters that are not as common tropes) to the game. Examples include "angel", "sword boy", or "omega".

Name: Racekart Riot
Description:
The racers in Racekart Riot race off in hopes of winning the prized Ruby Cup!  Armed with bananas, eggs, bombs, and more, the racers battle their way to first place. In this retro racing game, you don’t just win by coming in first place though, you must collect car and item cards in order to finish with style, earning you more points! When the race ends, the player with the most points wins the Ruby Cup and is crowned the champion!

—description from the publisher

Name: Flight from Hall Manor
Description:
Flight from Hall Manor is a horror-themed escape style game played simultaneously in real-time. Players have 15 minutes to get through three levels of a haunted manor, searching for staircases and, ultimately, the way out.

Players act simultaneously, revealing cards as they move through doorways and rooms, avoiding traps, collecting items, fighting spectral predators, and surviving a fire spreading through the house.

Players can work cooperatively or take off alone and work to escape without the others. Variable character abilities, benefits for coop and solo play, and over 200 manor map combinations make the game different every time.

Name: Quizz Pyrénées
Description:
Quizz Pyrénées is a set of 110 cards / 550 questions gathered in 5 themes about the Pyrenees.
For each question, 5 clues, increasingly easy. The less question a player uses to answer, the more points he or she will score.
Whoever scores the most points at the end of the game will be crowned the "Best Pyrenean"
The themes are:

     Fauna and flora
     Unique landscapes
     Heritage and traditions
     Sports and leisure
     Facts or characters in history

Name: Quizz Landes
Description:
Quizz Landes is a set of 110 cards / 550 questions gathered in 6 themes about the department of the Landes.
For each question, 5 clues, increasingly easy. The less question a player uses to answer, the more points he or she will score.
Whoever scores the most points at the end of the game will be crowned the "Best Landais"
The themes are:

     Culture and traditions
     Sports and leisure
     Places and heritage
     History and politics
     Gastronomy and Crafts
     Coastline and natural sites

Name: Charlotte Future City-Building Game
Description:
In this fun and easy game, 2-4 players each build their vision for the future of Charlotte. Players choose their objectives, what to build, and where to build it. The player with the best city wins the game! This game was built as a part of the  Charlotte Future 2040 Comprehensive Plan public involvement process.

On your turn, a player takes two cards from the central play area. A player may take a Framework Policy card, which provides victory points for fulfilling its objectives; or a Place Type/Projects & Programs card to place in their city to meet Framework Policy objectives.

After a player selects their two cards, they discard a specified number of cards from the play area, based on the number of players. Empty spaces in the central play area are then filled with new cards. Play then proceeds clockwise.

The game ends after 11 rounds, or a total of 22 cards for each player. Players score their own Framework Policy cards and shared Bonus Point cards. The player with the most points wins.

Name: Quizz Bordeaux
Description:
Quizz Bordeaux is a set of 110 cards / 550 questions gathered in 6 themes about the city of the Port of the Moon.
For each question, 5 clues, increasingly easy. The less question a player uses to answer, the more points he or she will score.
Whoever scores the most points at the end of the game will be crowned the "Best Bordelais"
The themes are:

     Culture and traditions
     History
     Gastronomy
     Places / Heritage
     Oenology and wines
     sports

Name: Quizz Bassin d'Arcachon
Description:
Quizz Bassin d'Arcachon is a set of 110 cards / 550 questions gathered in 6 themes about the Bassin d'Arcachon (a bay of the Atlantic Ocean on the southwest coast of France).
For each question, 5 clues, increasingly easy. The less question a player uses to answer, the more points he or she will score.
Whoever scores the most points at the end of the game will be crowned the "Best connoisseur of the Basin"
The themes are:

     Natural sites
     History and politics
     Places / Heritage
     Sports and leisure
     Culture and traditions
     Gastronomy & Crafts

Name: Quizz Pays basque
Description:
Quizz Pays basque is a set of 110 cards / 550 questions gathered in 6 themes about the department of the Landes.
For each question, 5 clues, increasingly easy. The less question a player uses to answer, the more points he or she will score.
Whoever scores the most points at the end of the game will be crowned the "Best Basque".

The themes are:

     Culture and traditions
     History
     Gastronomy
     Places / Heritage
     Ocean and coast
     sports

Name: Seal Squad
Description:
Seal Squad. The fishy game of cooperation!

Play is important.  Play is for FUN.  Play is for CONNECTING. Play is a great way for kids to LEARN.  Given how rushed life is, it can be hard to set aside time to just PLAY!

It's East to Play!

     Roll both dice
     As a team choose the best Seal to move
     Collect fish and beat the Walrus


—description from the publisher

Name: Operation Crusader: The Winter Battles for Tobruk, 1941 – Designer Signature Edition
Description:
Operation Crusader, The Winter Battles for Tobruk, 1941 is played on a map of Libya and Egypt immediately south and east of Tobruk, where the battle was fought. It uses playing pieces that represent the actual military units that participated in this campaign. Each player represents the commander of the Axis or Allied forces. The individual ground units represent battalions of approximately 700 soldiers (50-60 tanks in an armored battalion, 12-24 guns in an artillery battalion), or companies of about 200 soldiers (15-20 tanks or armored cars in an armored company, 4-12 guns in an artillery battery). Each hex represents 2 kilometers or 1.25 miles. Each turn is a third of a day.

Operation Crusader is a two-player game, with team play possible for the full campaign game. 
One player assumes the role of the Axis and the other player assumes the role of the Allies. 
Each player moves his units and executes attacks on enemy units in turn, attempting to fulfill the game’s Victory Conditions. 
To move from one space to another, each unit expends a portion of its Movement Allowance. 
Combat is resolved through Battles by "firing" at opposing units and then determining the outcome of any hits scored. A die is used to resolve combat.

The classic monster game returns with a newly-streamlined game system throughout (no more pre-plotting movement!). This new edition emphasizes playability while capturing the flavor of the original game. The game adds smaller scenarios (6 total), each covering a shorter and smaller part of the historic battle, and a full campaign game which allows players to experience the full sweep of Operation Crusader. Two shorter versions of the entire campaign (the most exciting parts) are also included for those wanting less game play time.

Featured scenarios include:
    • Scenario 1: Gabr Saleh (5 turns, 1 map), AM 19 Nov - PM 20 Nov
    • Scenario 2: Bir El-Gobi (5 turns, 1 map), AM 19 Nov - PM 20 Nov
    • Scenario 3: Sidi Rezegh (8 turns, 1 map), AM 21 Nov - PM 23 Nov
    • Scenario 4: Storming the Frontier (8 turns, 1 map), AM 21 Nov - PM 23 Nov
    • Scenario 5: Rommel's Dash (11 turns, 1 map), AM 24 Nov - PM 27 Nov
    • Scenario 6: The Cauldron (8 turns, 2 maps), AM 24 Nov - PM 26 Nov
    • "Short" Campaign Game (14 turns, all 4 maps), AM 19 Nov - PM 23 Nov
    • "Long" Campaign Game (31 turns, all 4 maps), AM 19 Nov - PM 28 Nov
    • "Extended" Campaign Game (50 turns, all 4 maps), AM 19 Nov - PM 5 Dec

—description from the publisher's website

Name: Unplanned Adventures
Description:
Unplanned Adventures encapsulates the most action packed and fun parts of a roleplaying game with no prior planning, no apps, and no one stuck being the GM. The goal of the game is simple, to earn XP by entertaining your fellow players. What and Where cards quickly establish a game setting and throw you right into the action. Word cards help you develop your character and build the shared story world. You can do and create the impossible, but test the boundaries of probability too much and you will pay a terrible price as your own words are turned against you!

Wait, that sounds scary? You don’t think you have ideas for stories? Don’t worry, it turns out we all have enough shared reference points from books, movies, and myths to help create complex and vibrant worlds. We think you’ll be astonished to find the stories that are hiding within you and your friends’ minds. Have an Unplanned Adventure, you won’t regret it.

—description from the publisher

Name: Kraft Heinz Variety Game Pack
Description:
Kraft Heinz Variety Game Pack contains three food-themed family games in themed packaging:


    KRAFT Macaroni & Cheese Game: Satisfy your cravings by rolling the dice to play matching noodle cards and push the Cheesasaurus Rex piece up the Noodle Meter — but make sure you don't run out of noodles!
    JELL-O Jiggler Slap Game: This card game is a quick-thinking, hand-slapping treat. Be the first to slap the correct card on the JELL-O gelatin flavor that's called out to win. You might even have to wiggle and jiggle for your favorite flavor!
    HEINZ Ketchup Dice Game: It’s HEINZ ketchup or bust in this press-your-luck game of risk versus reward! Roll the dice and collect as much ketchup as possible to score 57 points.


These three games are available only in this set and are not sold separately.

Name: Maphex
Description:
Maphex is a derivative of the masterpiece HEX (Piet Hein 1940) where your opponent's move determines which sub-board you can play on (mechanism from Ultimate Tic-Tac-Toe).

MATERIAL


     9x9 HEX board composed of 3x3 sub-boards.
     41 red counters and 41 blue counters


Maphex can also be played on a 16x16 board, that also seems more balanced.

PREPARATION

Place the board in the middle of the playing surface. Players take their corresponding discs (blue or red). Determine the starting player by any peaceful means.

HOW TO PLAY

The second player decides which sub-board the first player must place the first disc on. The first player places a disc of her colour on any empty space of that sub-board.

From now on, starting with the second player, players alternate turns placing a disc of their colour on an empty space of the board in a sub-board that corresponds with the position of the disc just placed by their opponent within the sub-board it’s been placed.

If this is not possible, then the player can place the disc on any sub-board (this happens once per game at most).

Note: One of the cells of each sub-board maps to the sub-board it’s in. These are called ‘autocells’ and are marked with a dot for clarity.

GOAL

If, at the end of your turn, both sides of your colour are connected by a continuous chain of discs of your colour you immediately win the game (just like in HEX).

—description from the designer

Name: Deadball: Year IV
Description:
Deadball: Year IV features:


     Updated rosters for the 2020 and 1912 Southern Circuit seasons, featuring hundreds of colorful players like Oil Can Morris, Coaker Veach, and Limerock Jones
     A ballpark mystery: “Who Beaned Bullet Wik?”
     Updated Nine Game Pennant campaigns—the fastest, most exciting way to play the game
     Two short stories set in the Deadball universe, where every pitch is a potential tragedy
     A tiny mystery starring Gilda Carr, the hero of the critically acclaimed novel Westside


—description from the publisher

Name: Sicher zur Schule mit Quacks
Description:
An exciting traffic game for 2-6 people from 6 years.
Everyone goes to school, but nobody goes alone!
Everyone has 2 figures that they have to bring quickly and safely to the school yard. Traffic questions need to be answered and roads need to be crossed safely. If you have collected enough points, Quacks will help you a lot further to your goal! A traffic game with colorfully illustrated instructions, exciting until the last minute. Not just for school beginners!

—user summary

Name: Best of Friends 2
Description: Best of Friends 2 follows 2013’s Best of Friends with 12 more scenarios from the Swedish Friendly Fire ASL Tournament and also includes an 8Ë × 22Ë geomorphic mapboard that originally appeared in Friendly Fire Pack 6 and has been repainted here by Charlie Kibler as board 85.

Name: Carnival
Description: In Carnival you start with a handful of creature cards. You can play these in front of you or to contribute to the central pile. Creatures in front of you will earn you points, but only if there are more creatures of the same type in the central pile. How many creatures are you going to contribute to the central pile?

Name: MicroMacro: Crime City – More Crime: Confidence Trick & Baby-Party
Description:
Two bonus cases:


     Confidence Trick (1 out of 5 difficulty)
     Baby-Party (2 out of 5 difficulty)


German edition was included Spielbox magazine #5/2020 and Ringbote magazine #4/2020.
English edition was included in Spielbox magazine #4/2021 and Tabletop Gaming #54 of May 2021. Was also part of the rewards from Game Boy Geek Kickstarter 2021 campaign.

Name: PolitSABOTAGE
Description:
PolitSABOTAGE is a role-playing business game, where players can practice communication, public speaking and bluff recognizing skills.
The Goal of the Game: Players are Members of the Parliament (MP). 
Every player secretly receives a card with a role, resulting in 2 commands: Coalition and Opposition. Players  have to communicate with each other, compete for the Chairman position and debate to ensure that their team wins.

     The MPs  without powers play until the end of the game.


Requires: 6-16 players (best 10) and a Game Master (GM).


     The GM, players, teams, roles and goal of the Game.


The Game requires the GM, who does not have a playing role. They monitor the playing time, announce the beginning and the end of game actions, treat all players impartially and monitor compliance with the rules (see the sections «Forbidden in the Game» and «Sanctions»), settle conflicts between players and impose sanctions (if necessary). In case of a dispute on the correctness / fairness of the GM's actions, they must be supported by 3 players (at least).

The players (6-16 people) get the Role Cards. Then they are divided into two teams in a random manner:
- Coalition team (the players with the Coalition Supporter and Intelligence Agent Role Cards);
- Opposition team (the players with the Oppositionist and Head of the Opposition Role Cards).


     The Goal of the Game is to ensure victory for your team.



     The Game Ends with the victory of one of the teams:


- the Coalition team wins if all members of the Opposition team are deprived of their powers
- the Opposition team wins if the number of the Opposition players is equal to the number of the Coalition players

Name: Alchematch
Description:
It’s your first day at Potion school! Can you mix and match the elixirs to create the most magical brew?

SETUP
Group all of your Blinks together to create your bubbling cauldron. The game begins the moment you do!

GAMEPLAY
Each turn, rearrange your Blinks in an attempt to create matches. A “match” is 3 or more Blinks of the same color in a cluster. Matched Blinks get replaced by new colors. Sometimes, new colors will immediately create a match, and these matches will cascade one after the other if you position your Blinks correctly.

You’ll notice as you make matches that your Blinks will begin bubbling - this shows how alchemically activated each Blink is. Each time a Blink is matched, it increases in alchemical power, which causes it to bubble more and more intensely. Eventually, after 10 matches, a Blink can become a Bomb.

Bombs appear as spinning points of color. To activate a Bomb, click the Blink. This will cause an alchemical explosion, turning all adjacent Blinks to the color of the bomb, and automatically creating a huge matching cluster.

But be careful - Bombs only last a few seconds before they revert back to their basic form. If you miss it, you’ll have to power up that Blink again.

If you are playing with 12 or fewer Blinks, it is possible to end up in a situation where no matches are possible. If this happens, simply triple-click a single Blink to change its color, potentially creating a match.

WIN CONDITION
Alchematch has no explicit goal, and can be played endlessly!

VARIANT RULES
Alchematch can be played by a stricter set of rules for greater challenge. First, place 12 Blinks in a 3 x 4 rhombus formation, with distinct rows and columns.

During gameplay, instead of moving Blinks freely, you must instead break off rows or columns of the rhombus and re-attach them to the opposite end. You may rotate the rows or columns, but must always maintain the overall shape. This requires you to think spatially to make matches each turn.

Name: Smash Up: Goblins
Description:
Goblins come to Smash Up, and bring all that glitters!  The goblins desire for gold and jewels might blind them to all the dangers associated with mining, but boy when it pays off...

And just like that, the Goblins deck will be risky but exciting!  Flip coins for effects big or small, and see what happens.

—description from the publisher

Name: Eastern Front Operational Battles
Description:
Eastern Front Operational Battles Quad features four standalone games on the Eastern Front in WWII at an operational level. "Pincers" and "Operation Fredericus" (1942), and "Orel Salient" and "Operation Rumiantsev" (1943).

In May of 1942, portions of the Red Army were to attack the German 6th Army, as mandated by Stalin. This was to be a pincers type attack, enveloping Kharkov. The Germans coincidentally were planning an assault in May against the salient which formed the southern base of the Soviet May offensive. The Red Army struck first, and five days later the German attack commenced. These double offensives are what are covered in “Pincers” and “Operation Fredericus”. As the German Zitadelle offensive of 1943 was winding down, the Soviets launched a major attack of their own on the northern part of the Kursk area. Then on August 3 the Soviets attacked the southern part of the Kursk area. “Orel Salient” and “Operation Rumiantsev” cover these actions.

Eastern Front Operational Battles use the same basic rule set in all four games as one would expect in a quad game. The rules are accessible and straight forward for playability, and at the same time, all aspects, such as movement rates, combat outcomes, and so on, are based on historical analysis. All of the games play at the operational level. Units are mostly regiments/brigades and divisions in the 1942 games, and divisions and corps in the 1943 games.

Product Information:
    Complexity: Low/Medium
    Time Scale: 1 day per turn for 1942 games, 2 days per turn for 1943 games
    Map Scale: 4 miles or 6.4 km/hex for 1942 games, 6 miles per hex for 1943 games
    Unit Scale: mostly regiments and divisions for 1942 games, mostly divisions and corps for 1943 games
    Players: 1 or 2 (best with 2)
    Solitaire: High
    Playing Time: 2 hours

Game Components:
    4 Maps (17x22" each)
    2.5 Countersheets
    4 Player Aid Cards
    1 Rulebook
    1 Playbook

Name: Manassas: Sunday, July 21st 1861 – Designer Signature Edition
Description:
"Manassas, Designer Signature Edition" marks the return of the original tactical level Civil War simulation for two or more players covering the First Battle of Manassas, July 21st, 1861. Minor game enhancements keep this classic game true to its original design with organizational loss displays added.

Manassas, Designer Signature Edition is a tactical level Civil War simulation for 2 or more players covering the First Battle of Manassas, Sunday, July 21st, 1861. Considered one of the best American Civil War games ever published, the entire package is beautifully rendered based on the original design with game enhancements by designer, Richard Britton.

Product Information:
Complexity: Medium
Time Scale: 15 minutes per turn
Map Scale: 135 yards/hex
Unit Scale: infantry regiments, battalions and detached companies. artillery batteries and sections. HQ and individual commanders.
Players: 2 or more
Solitaire: High
Playing Time: 4+ hours

Components:
2 Maps
2 Countersheets
4 Player Aid Cards
2 Loss Record Displays
1 Loss Record logsheet (optional use)

—description from the publisher's website
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Universal Rule: The Void
Description:
The Void (CPM 0618) is a promo planet (well, the lack of a planet) card for Universal Rule.

This Universal Rule card is a new planet (almost). It's one that is purely planet destruction, and sometimes it's even one of your own.

—description from the publisher


Planet:

     CPM 0618



Released in the January 2017 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

Name: The Mini Quest 2
Description:
The Mini quest on steroïds!

Same as before, 1 to 5 heroes wander the hex-map, defeat counter-monsters, solve card-quests, and gain experience in the form of stars.

But when a hero wins his 3rd star, the Boss rises and terrorises the peninsula. The heroes have to vanquish it before the capital city is destroyed.

You'll need dice (at least three, 6 is better, 6 per player is best), pencils, erasers.

Name: MakerSpace
Description:
In this 18 card Worker Placement game you play as teams of Makers sharing the same small workspace. You will need to share the limited machines while managing your Time and Materials to add completed projects to your Portfolio. Then Submit it to win awards, Prizes and prestige along the way!

You begin the game by making the board out of three Workspace cards and six prize cards,all cards are double sided with unique actions and abilities so each game is different!

Players take turns placing their workers into an action space and choosing to take one of the available actions such as; Gaining resources,upgrading resources or attempting to stake a claim on a prize.
Because your Workers are cards, this allows a twist on traditional worker placement. During the game your workers can be flipped; One side blocking your opponents from taking the same action as you, the other allowing your opponent to also take the same action at the cost of returning your worker to you,giving you an extra turn.

The first player to submit enough points to one of the available prize cards will get to claim it, gaining victory points and a powerful unique ability they may use for the rest of the game. Abilities such as; gaining an additional worker, being able to take multiple actions with one worker or even choosing where their opponent must place their worker.

The first player to claim three prizes wins. Or if the 4th/5th prize(depending on player count) is taken and a single player has yet to claim three prizes, then the player with the most victory points will win.

—description from the designer

Name: Trivial Pursuit: Nord-Pas-de-Calais
Description:
(Re)Discover the region Nord Pas-de-Calais in 1800 questions.

Content: 1 board, 300 question-answer cards, 2 card boxes, 1 die, 6 pie charts, 36 colored marker triangles.

Name: The Catholic Card Game: Christmas Expansion
Description:
A very special expansion pack all about celebrating Advent and Christmas as Catholics!

This is a 30 card expansion to add in to play with your other Catholic Card Game cards. This expansion does not come with a box, it is meant to be kept in a box with your other cards.

Name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: British – Valentine
Description:
The Valentine is a British infantry tank, built in a variety of marks (or variants) during the war. Used extensively in the battles of North Africa it had a reputation for being a well-protected vehicle, capable of operating under heavy enemy fire. As the war progressed the little Valentine was surpassed by larger tanks, capable of mounting heavier guns and more armour.

The Valentine Expansion Pack brings another first to the World of Tanks Miniatures Game, being the first light tank. Traditionally light tanks combine high speed with the ability to scout out and distract enemy tanks, providing friendly tanks with an easier kill.
Families: Game: World of Tanks Miniatures Game (Wargaming.net / GF9)

Name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: German – Stug III G
Description:
The StuG III (Sturmgeschütz III) assault gun was one of Germany’s most produced vehicles during World War II. Based on the versatile Panzer III hull, it had an armoured superstructure or upper hull instead of a turret. Removing the turret allowed engineers to mount the powerful 7.5 cm Pak 39 L/48 gun, making it a powerful tank hunter.

The StuG III Ausf. G Expansion Pack adds a new tank type for players to employ in their platoons, the tank destroyer. When shooting from cover, tank destroyers are more likely to shrug off incoming enemy fire. Combined this with a Survivability of 2, the StuG III Ausf. G is best suited to lie in wait, providing covering fire to other tanks in the platoon.
Families: Game: World of Tanks Miniatures Game (Wargaming.net / GF9)

Name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: American – M3 Lee
Description:
The M3 Lee was a medium tank, used by both the U.S. and British forces (where it had the designation M3 Grant) and saw use in the battles of North Africa. It was quite unique in that it mounted a 75mm gun in the hull and a smaller 37mm gun in a small top turret above the superstructure.

The M3 Lee Expansion Pack gives players a tank with a very similar stat line to its successor, the M4A1 Sherman. It features with a good mix of Mobility, Initiative and Survivability, whilst the fixed main gun and lower Initiative results in a lower point cost making it a good choice for gamers on a budget.
Families: Game: World of Tanks Miniatures Game (Wargaming.net / GF9)

Name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: Soviet – SU-100
Description:
The SU-100 is a Soviet tank destroyer based off the extensively produced T-34 and T-34-85 chassis. Produced from September 1944 through June 1945, it saw service in the Red Army all the way through to the end of the war in Berlin and beyond. Combining well sloped armour and a deadly 100mm D10S gun, they were nicknamed ‘cat-killers’ for their ability to know out heavy German tanks like the Panther and Tiger.

The SU-100 Expansion Pack is the second tank destroyer to join the World of Tanks: Miniatures Game and brings new tactical challenges for players and opponents. The Firepower stat of 6 is currently unmatched by any other tank in the game.
Families: Game: World of Tanks Miniatures Game (Wargaming.net / GF9)

Name: Rockstar Portfolio Manager
Description:
In Rockstar Portfolio Manager, players are promising multi-asset portfolio managers, shortlisted by a billionaire as candidates to manage his wealth. They are each given seed capital by the billionaire and have to build the largest value investment portfolio over the market cycles to prove their worth.

Every round unveils a new scenario (a random market cycle), to which players have partial information due to a game mechanism called "initial research". During a player's turn (within the round), they resolve the payoffs associated with the scenario and their investment portfolios draws and plays action cards. They also have the option of re-balancing their portfolio to best position it for maximum investment gains in the future scenarios. When the last player for the round has finished their turn, the scenario is discarded and a new scenario card is unveiled in a new round.

The game ends when there are no scenarios cards and the last player has finished their turn. A player wins by having the largest portfolio value.

-description from publisher

Name: L' Apéro Jeu Oléron
Description:
Test your knowledge on the Ile d'Oléron for a drink with family or friends!

Share a funny and friendly moment while having fun.

With nearly 300 riddles and questions, you will learn a number of unexpected and quirky secrets on this multi-faceted island.

Play in team. One member of the team pick a card and ask a question (out of 4/5 per card) to his teammates, whichever team scores the most cards wins

Name: Oh Gnome!: Lawn Warfare
Description:
You and your neighbors are in competition to see who can have the most decked out and ridiculous lawn. Taking "Keeping up with the Joneses" to a level gnome one has ever seen before.

In this Cul-de-sac, anything goes! Steal your neighbor's gnomes if you must because the cops are gnomewhere to be found.
Set traps to protect your precious gnomes, and hoard away because the HOA isn't writing fines for cluttered lawns. Or at least try... let's face it, thieves will be thieves.
Let the War for Lawn Supremacy begin!

In Oh Gnome!, players will be playing three different card types: Gnomes, Traps, Abilities. Gnome and Trap cards each with their own values helping the player to achieve enough points to be crowned the victor. Each Gnome has a unique power that activates when they enter a lawn. These powers can be used strategically to create chain combos to devastate your opponents' lawns. Be careful though because if you don't protect your Gnomes, they can be stolen right back without regard. Players can arm traps which generally do something bad when they are tripped but some are simply caches to boost your lawn value and achieve a sly victory. To cap off the card types, there are ability cards which are one time use cards that have great effects. The deck runs out fast and there's no reshuffling so paying attention to how many are left can be used to achieve a spectacular game ending combo.

This is a quick play game where games generally last around 10 to 20 minutes and occasionally get up to 30 minutes.

—description from the designer

Name: Zoom Inspector Spellor's Investigations
Description:
10 crime scenes and many cases to solve… but not all the clues are obvious and not all the trails identified lead to a solution.  Can you be a careful observer and find all the hidden details? Can you help Inspector Spellor in his  investigation? To do this you will need to be faster than your playmates in finding all the words. By drawing the Chance cards and rolling the dice, you will continue the investigation, which will change from one game to the next. Each time the clues and the words to be found will be different.  Their orthographic difficulties will put you to the test. Happy investigating everyone!

—description from the publisher

Name: Untamed: Ursan Gambler Promo Cards
Description:
Limited edition foil promo cards available during Kickstarter project Untamed: Feral Factions

3x Ursan Gambler - promo animal (Panda faction)

Arrive: Put the top card of your deck into your Support Area. If it was a Panda card, the next card you play this turn costs 1 less Power.

Note: This ability is different from the Ursan Gambler found in the base game. If you want to use these promo cards, you need to replace them with the cards in the core box.

Name: LoveLive!: School Idol Collection
Description:
LoveLive! School Idol Collection is a trading card game of LoveLive! project.
This card game is different from most other trading card games, it can be player by 2 or more players.
In this game, players do one action each turn, play a character card, draw cards until have 4 card in hand or hold a live with characters. Each live card has a score, and the player who get 9 scores will win the game.

Name: Labyrint 3.0
Description:
The popular Labyrinth (Swedish TV series) game in a new edition, with four new, exciting challenges:


     Take orbs through the labyrinth,
     Look for tiles in the slime catapult, 
     Find clues in the keys and boxes
     Decipher the secret code.


The game is standalone but works excellently along with the challenges in previous editions of the game.

Name: Catalyst: Solo mode
Description:
The official solo mode of Catalyst - originally released as a promotional set of rules in IoGioco game magazine.

GOAL OF THE GAME
Confront your skills against a fearsome Artificial Intelligence (AI).

PREPARATION

     Choose the difficulty level: easy (+10 PV), standard (+20 PV), advanced (+30 PV).
     Follow the instructions for preparing a 2-player game. You are the first player.
     Return all building cards to the box with the exception of a building costing 1, one that costs 2, one that costs 3 and one that costs 4. They must all be of a different color and randomly selected (e.g.: play with the blue “1” building, the “2” red building, the “3” yellow building and the “4” green building).


PLAYING THE GAME
Play multiple turns in a row until the game ends.
During each of your turns you must perform one of the three actions of the game, with the following additions to the normal rules:

      Collect Contributions: you get coins as usual, and the AI gets a military power token.
      Recruit a Catalyst: You recruit a Catalyst as usual, then take the first card to the left of the one you recruited and place it, without looking at it, in the deck of AI's scoring pile. If you recruit the first Catalyst to the right of the deck (the one on the space marked with “+1”), then place the top card of the draw pile, without looking at it, in the scoring pile of the AI. 
      Activate a Catalyst: activate a Catalyst as usual, then place the card on top of the drawing deck, without looking at it, in the AI’s scoring pile.


Note: When you get coins or actions to recruit a Catalyst through a Catalyst or a building’s effects, and when you spend Chain activation tokens to activate Catalysts, the additions to the normal rules (see above) do not apply: This means that while you perform the effect of an activated Catalyst or building, the AI does not get any military power tokens nor you must put cards in its scoring pile.

THE END OF YOUR TURN
As in the standard rules, after you have chosen and performed one action (and possibly the AI has gained a card in its scoring pile or a military power token), your turn is over. If one or more spaces of the board are empty, slide the other cards to the right until there are no gaps, then draw new cards from the deck to fill the board back up to 5 cards.

THE END OF THE GAME
When the last card of the reserve deck is discarded or put on the board, the game ends immediately.
Count your VPs as usual, including the goal card’s points. The AI instead obtains the VPs written on the cards in its scoring pile, the VPs provided by each pair of its military power tokens (and for the majority), and additional VPs depending on the difficulty level chosen (see Preparation). If you scored at least 1 VP more than the AI, you won – otherwise, try harder!

—description from the publisher

Name: The Catholic Card Game: Casting Stones Expansion
Description:
The Casting Stones Expansion is a bag of 5 smooth(ish) stones that you get to throw at the sinners you are at table with!

Play the Catholic Card Game with the Casting Stones Expansion with one of the four new rule variations included in the bag and when the time is right, cast your stone!

-description from publisher's website

Name: Viscounts of the West Kingdom: Courier
Description:
Additional Townsfolk Card released during the spielbox (english Edition) Kickstarter.

Ability: choose one of those

1) Shuffle your discards back into your Draw Pile. Players must have at least 1 card in their discard pile to resolve this

2) Discard 2 cards from either your hand or Draw Pile. If you have no Draw Pile, you may shuffle your discards to discard from it
Families: Series: The West Kingdom Trilogy (Garphill Games)

Name: Terraforming Mars: Asteroid Rights Promo Card
Description:
Promo card for Terraforming Mars, included in Spielbox 1/21.

Asteroid Rights

Gain 2 asteroids to this card.

Action: Spend 1M€ to add 1 asteroid to ANY card, OR spend 1 asteroid here to raise your M€ production 1 step or gain 2 titanium.

Promo card X34

Name: ドッグフェローズ (Dog Fellows)
Description:
Let's line up the dogs as there are times when it's good to line up!

In the card game ãƒ‰ãƒƒã‚°ãƒ•ã‚§ãƒ­ãƒ¼ã‚º (Dog Fellows), players want to arrange dogs to create a large pack.

Name: Monopoly: Dragon Ball Super
Description:
Fierce competition is rife for Dragon Ball enthusiasts and challengers in Monopoly: Dragon Ball Super, where a battle with Beerus, the mythical God of Destruction, sets the stage for a Tournament of Power where the strongest fighter will win.

Buy, sell, and trade characters from the Dragon Ball Super universes to come out with the most riches. The custom sunburst game board features 26 spaces named for your favorite fighters, including Goku, Jiren, Gohan, Piccolo, Frost, and Vegeta in various forms, around a collage of other series characters such as Androids 17 and 18, Kamesennin, Hit, Toppo, Tenshinhan, and more!

—description from the publisher

Name: Armoured Corps
Description:
Armoured Corps wargame rules allow players to command a combined-arms battlegroup fighting battles during the third world war.

Scope
These rules are designed to be quick to play with large forces from a single company to multiple battalions while still giving realistic results.

The rules are also designed to simulate the role of a formation commander so much of the minutiae of modern armoured combat is incorporated into generalised statistics or dice roles. For example, the formation commander will not be deciding on which type of ammunition (HEAT, APDS etc) each tank will be firing when engaging an enemy unit, this would be left up to the tank’s own crew. So many parts of the rules that may seem simple or “glossed-over” are simply below the player’s (acting as overall commander) level of command.

Sequence of Play
Various sequences and methods of unit activation were considered however it was decided to go back to the classic “I go, you go” sequence (albeit with interruptions form an opponent’s units on overwatch).

Morale
Morale has been heavily simplified to a single dice roll at the end of each turn for any units that have come under fire and been suppressed. This determines if they fall back, continue fighting or give up, surrendering or leaving the battle area.

Ground Scale
The approximate ground scale of 1” =100 metres was chosen as it would allow for realistic weapon ranges to be depicted on a reasonable sized table without being able to fire across the whole area, allowing more emphasis on manoeuvre and positioning of units.

—description from the publisher

Name: Metamachy
Description:
Metamachy is a chess-like game for two players played on a 12x12 game board. The game contains sixty pieces of twelve different types, thirty for each player: King, Queen, Eagle, Lion, Prince, Bishop, Knight, Camel, Rook, Cannon, Elephant and twelve Pawns.

The game presents players with twelve different starting set-ups, with Black choosing the set-up, then White making the first move.

Name: GeoXpert
Description:
GeoXpert is an original combined alignment and guessing game with collector cards to better know the countries of the World. The principle is simple. From a card which shows a flag, you first guess which country it is. Then you place the card in a line, ranking by area horizontally or by population vertically. If you loose, you get more cards to get rid off. The winner is the first to exhaust his/her stock.
With GeoXpert, learn all countries' flag, name, capital, and other facts and quiz your family and friends.
GeoXpert may be played with 2, 3, 4 or more players. It may be played alone too.
There is a card of each country. The verso has only the flag and the continent, the recto gives country's name (in English, French and the official languages of the country), capital, currency, area, population, flag and coat of arms.

—description from the designer

Name: L' Apéro Jeu Rétais
Description:
Share the time of an aperitif with family or friends, a funny and friendly moment while broadening your knowledge of the Ile de Ré.

In 250 questions, learn about the island and its secrets with this fun game, imbued with love for this charming island.

Play in teams. 
One member of the team pick a card and ask a question (out of 4/5 per card) to his teammates, whichever team scores the most cards wins.

Name: L' Apéro Jeu Angevin
Description:
In L'Apéro Jeu Angevin game discover Anjou while having fun! 
In 170 questions, you will learn a number of secrets about the culture, sport, history, tourism, traditions and celebrities of Anjou.

Play in team. 
One member of the team pick a card and ask a question (out of 4/5 per card) to his teammates, whichever team scores the most cards wins

Name: Lockup: Kulbak Pack
Description:
The Kulbak Pack is a 7 Card mini-expansion for Lockup
It features three new goal cards (instant, leader, and end game) and four new tome cards. Simply add these to your existing game to introduce new challenges and strategies.

Was also available as part of the rewards for backing Game Boy Geek 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

-description from publisher

Name: Cthulhu Wars: The Invasion
Description:
Contains:

- New Cthulhu Wars Faction sheet "The Invasion"
- 6 new Spellbooks
- Lord Baphomet miniature
- 6 Larvae miniatures
- 6 Gryllus miniatures
- 4 Fiends miniatures

The game begins with Portents on the board. For these we use Invasion Tokens, which look portentious. Your Larvae must travel across the board to the Portents and try to bring them to live in a multi-stage process, which ends with the Portents becoming full-fledged Lord’s Shadows and channeling Hell.

You don’t have Cultists. You can’t do Rituals of Annihilation. You almost don’t need Power, at least not like the other Factions do. You can spend Doom to take certain actions. Those weird Portents are scattered over the map.

Name: L' Apéro Jeu Basque
Description:
Test your knowledge of the French Basque Country during an aperitif with family or friends. Share a funny and friendly moment while cultivating yourself.

With nearly 300 questions, you will discover a number of unexpected and offbeat anecdotes, just like the author.

Play in team. 
One member of the team pick a card and ask a question (out of 4/5 per card) to his teammates, whichever team scores the most cards wins

Name: L' Apéro Jeu Charentais
Description:
L' Apéro Jeu Charentais lets you share the time of an aperitif with family or friends a funny and friendly moment while broadening your knowledge of the Charentes (Charente & Charente-Maritime departments).

In almost 3oo questions, learn about the Charente with this game full of humor and original anecdotes.

Play in team. 
One member of the team pick a card and ask a question (out of 4/5 per card) to his teammates, whichever team scores the most cards wins

Name: L' Apéro Jeu du Littoral
Description:
L'Apéro Jeu du Littoral lets you test your knowledge of the French coasts for an aperitif with family or friends!

Share a funny and friendly moment by cultivating yourself.

With nearly 300 questions, you will take a tour of France of the coasts, beaches and islands. 
The French coast will no longer hold any secrets for you!

Play in team. One member of the team pick a card and ask a question (out of 4/5 per card) to his teammates, whichever team scores the most cards wins

Name: L' Apéro Jeu Gascon
Description:
Test the time of an aperitif with family or friends, your knowledge of Gascony, thanks to L'Apéro Jeu Gascon !

Share a funny and friendly moment by cultivating yourself.

With nearly 300 questions, you will discover a number of unexpected and offbeat anecdotes, just like the author.

Play in team. 
One member of the team pick a card and ask a question (out of 4/5 per card) to his teammates, whichever team scores the most cards wins.

Name: L' Apéro Jeu Landais
Description:
Test your knowledge of the Landes region for an aperitif with family or friends. Share a funny and friendly moment while cultivating yourself.

With nearly 300 questions, you will discover many unexpected and offbeat anecdotes about this wooded region of the South-West.

Play in team. 
One member of the team pick a card and ask a question (out of 4/5 per card) to his teammates, whichever team scores the most cards wins

Name: L' Apéro Jeu Limousin
Description:
L'Apéro Jeu Limousin lets you expand your knowledge of the Limousin region with an aperitif with family or friends!

Share a funny and friendly moment by cultivating yourself.

With nearly 170 questions, you have enough to discover many anecdotes about the region, its history, its culture and much more.

Play in team. 
One member of the team pick a card and ask a question (out of 4/5 per card) to his teammates, whichever team scores the most cards wins

Name: L' Apéro Jeu Lot-et-Garonnais
Description:
Enjoy an aperitif with family or friends thanks to your knowledge of Lot-et-Garonne. 
Have a fun and friendly moment while discovering unsuspected aspects of Lot-et-Garonnaise history.

In 170 questions, take a tour of the department.

Play in team. 
One member of the team pick a card and ask a question (out of 4/5 per card) to his teammates, whichever team scores the most cards wins

Name: L' Apéro Jeu Poitevin
Description:
L' Apéro Jeu Poitevin
For an aperitif with family or friends, share a funny and friendly moment while having fun with the expressions in patois (loval slang)!

8 types of games for adults and children.

Name: L' Apéro Jeu Vendéen
Description:
L'Apéro Jeu vendéen 
For an aperitif with family or friends, share a funny and friendly moment while having fun with the expressions in patois (local slang)!

8 types of games for adults and children.

Name: L' Apéro Jeu Berrichon
Description:
L'apéro jeu Berrichon
Both a quiz game and a guide, this object is a must have for discovering Berry while having fun.

In 210 questions, you will learn all the secrets of Berry's heritage, history, traditions, daily life and personalities.

Name: Treasure Tumble
Description:
You are an archaeologist who has finally uncovered a long rumored ancient treasure chamber. Glorious riches await you, but not without their challenges. Your excavations have unearthed ancient mechanisms that redirect treasure falling from great heights, how much can you now collect in your treasure buckets?

SETUP
Take your sushi roll case and lay it out on a flat surface. This will be the floor of your treasure chamber. Long press 2 Blinks until they flash white, then set them standing up on the sushi roll case. These are your treasure buckets. Take another Blink and set it between the two buckets. This trio of Blinks is the foundation of your treasure chamber.

Finally, take at least 1 Blink and triple click it. It should now be green with a swirling face. This Blink is your treasure spawner. It will drop one treasure piece whenever it is placed on top of the treasure chamber tower.

GAMEPLAY
The goal of this game is to collect as much treasure in your bucket as possible by using the mechanisms built into the treasure chamber walls.

The game is played in two stages. First, both players work together to assemble the treasure chamber. Take turns adding one Blink at a time to the tower and watching the mechanisms self-assign.

WIN CONDITION
When the bucket is full it will turn purple - the first player to fill their bucket with treasure is the winner!

However, if one of the players causes the tower to collapse, they must empty all the treasure from their bucket. Double-click a bucket to empty it. Then the first stage of the game is repeated and the tower is reassembled before treasure is allowed to tumble again.

Name: Dictator-y Little Bitch
Description:
2-6 players, 30-60 minutes, fully co-op, and inspired by video game boss battles and co-op games like Pandemic. The longer you play, the harder the game becomes, until there's nothing left for you to do except watch as the world burns.

Each player has an open hand of cards which are played to categories around the central Octagon in the hopes of reducing the villain's HP to zero before HE reduces the World's HP to zero. But cards only score when played atop other cards, and every time a turn is taken, the villain (the game itself) has a chance to remove players' cards from the Octagon before points can be scored against him. Not only that, but interspersed throughout the villain's deck are cards that render categories unusable for the rest of the game.

—description from the designer

Name: UNO: BTS
Description:
Basically the same as UNO, except with cards that feature the K-pop band BTS.

Cards that are different from traditional UNO:

The Dancing Wild card -- the next player in current order must perform a BTS dance routine in from of everyone OR draw three cards.

Name: Oléron, Aix, Madame Cube
Description:
270 Questions and answers on the islands of Oléron, Aix and Madame.
Can be played alone or with others, as a team or with friends!

Rules: Throw the 2 dice, you get 1 color and 1 number, your opponent chooses a card corresponding to the color and asks you question 1, 2 or 3.

Scoring: 1 point for a correct yellow or orange answer, 2 for a green or a blue and 3 points for a purple or a red.

Content: 90 cards of 3 questions (answers on the back),
6 card colors representing the degree of difficulty,
1 die of 6 colors and 1 die with the numbers 1,2 and 3

Name: Ré Cube
Description:
Discover the island of Ré in a fun way, while learning about history, geography, various facts ...
Can be played alone or with others, as a team or with friends!

Rules: Roll the 2 dice, you get 1 color and 1 number.
Your opponent chooses a card corresponding to the suit and asks you question n ° 1, 2 or 3.
Scoring: 1 point for a correct yellow or orange answer, 2 for a green or blue and 3 points for a purple or red.

Content: 90 cards of 3 questions (answers on the back), 6 color cards representing the degree of difficulty, 1 die of 6 colors and 1 die with the numbers 1, 2 and 3.

Name: La Rochelle Cube
Description:
La Rochelle Cube 288 questions and answers about La Rochelle'

Discover La Rochelle in a playful and entertaining way, learn about history, geography, various facts ...

Can be played alone, with others, as a team or with friends.

Rules: Roll 2 dice, you get 1 color and a number. Your opponent chooses a card corresponding to the suit and asks you question 1, 2 or 3.

Scoring: 1 point for a correct yellow or orange answer, 2 for a green or blue and 3 for a purple or red.

Content': 96 cards of 3 questions (answers on the back), 6 color cards representing the degree of difficulty, 1 die of 6 colors, and 1 die with the numbers 1,2 and 3.

Name: Paris Cube
Description:
Paris Cube 288 questions and answers to discover PARIS.

Can be played alone or with others but the most fun is in a team!

Rules: Roll 2 dice, you get 1 number and 1 color. Your opponent chooses a card of the color drawn and asks you question n ° 1, 2 or 3 corresponding to the number of the other die.
Scoring: 1 point for the 1st question, 2 for the 2nd and 3 points for the 3rd.

Content:
96 card classified by colored themes: characters, monuments, squares and streets, arts, entertainment, the Seine, metro, neighborhoods, markets, cemeteries ...
A 6 colors die and a die numbered 1,2,3.

Name: Brush Brothers Paint Co.
Description:
Brush Brothers Paint Co. is a family friendly color mixing card game. Brush Brothers plays in 15 min, is for 2-6 players and is for ages 8 and up.

In Brush Brothers, players are new employees for the Brush Brothers Paint Co. and are seeking to make a good first impression by mixing colors and completing company goals.

In this color based deck building game, players compete to collect paint cards and meet goals before the day’s end.

On a player turn, players may perform a variety of actions including mixing paint, matching paint, and meeting company goals.

To mix paint, players may mix any of the colors in their hand to pick up paint colors from the center row. For instance, I could use red and yellow to create orange.

To match colors players may pick up a color if they already have that exact color in their hand.

To meet company goals, players declare that they are seeking to meet a goal and if they have the required colors in their play area, they may collect the goal card.

Any cards used for an action are then placed in the player discard and can cycle through their deck back into their hand on a later turn.

Players start with an even mix of red, yellow, blue and white and can collect a variety of other colors. In this way every card can help to build your deck. Excluding the starter cards, every card is worth points at the end of the game.

The game ends when the center pile runs out. The player with the most points wins.

-description from designer

Name: Bier poker game
Description:
The most insane, immersive and drunken version of the world famous game that has captivated millions of people around the world.

Laughing DIY assignments, a delicious pot of beer, combined with the world-famous game of poker guarantee an incredibly pleasant evening.

Play a blood-curdling, strategic and downright drunken game for the big bucks or just for the sake of honor. Bluffing, gambling and hoping that luck is on your side… just prove that you are the king of beer poker!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Hvad er jeg?
Description: Play Hvad er jeg?, a.k.a. What am I?, with up to four friends by placing cards on your forehead, then taking turns asking questions to discover what object you are.

Name: Hvad er jeg?: Jobs
Description: Play Hvad er jeg? Jobs, a.k.a. What am I? Jobs, with up to four friends by placing cards on your forehead, then taking turns asking questions to discover what profession you represent.

Name: Wie is Wie
Description:
Are you good at guessing famous people? Then this game is for you. Here it's all about the question: Which famous person is on the map

Play the game in teams and try to guess which celebrity is involved in three different rounds, always using the same cards.

In round 1 you do this by explaining the celebrity in words, in round 2 you have to find out from a word and in round 3 the same people are portrayed. Whoever guesses the most celebrities in three rounds wins the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Het beste brein
Description:
Do you have the best brain in the Netherlands?

Congratulations… you are on your way to becoming "The Best Brain"! You grab that title in an exciting battle full of visual games and assignments based on the immensely popular TV quiz. And all this without even one knowledge question, because this fun board game is all about farmer smartness: a combination of common sense and good intuition. You absolutely do not need to have studied or to have a lot of knowledge ...


     Everyone can participate and win!
     With 8 rounds full of visual games and assignments like on TV now at home!


—description of the publisher (translated)

Name: iKNOW: All in
Description:
Are you a real quiz champion? Everyone plays at the same time, everyone bets on each other, but ... there is only one winner! Compared to other quiz games, iKNOW offers that little bit extra. You score points by answering questions correctly, but also by predicting the success of other players! How well do you know your opponents? Bet on the right player and score even if that player gives a wrong answer! This interactive trivia will get all players involved from start to finish!

—description from the publisher

Name: Memories
Description:
Are you ready for a nostalgic evening of reminiscing? Travel through time with your fellow players and discover how much you still know about the decade in which you grew up.

What events are in
your memory and what do you have to dig deep for? Maybe you know more than your parents, your grandfather, your neighbor or your best friend.

Amaze yourself and everyone
by answering a variety of questions about the 80's, 90's, 00's and 10's in six categories: music, television, sports, world news, movies and miscellaneous.

—description from the publisher

Name: Party & Co Family
Description:
With Party & Co Family, you can imitate, draw, squirm, answer original questions and conquer the funniest challenges. Have fun with the new Party & Co Family: a party for the whole family!

The game can be played in teams (maximum 3 teams of 2 or more players) or with maximum 3 individuals. Divide the players into teams. Choose which side of the game board you want to play with: the normal course takes about 50 minutes. The short trail is about 25 minutes.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: British vs Pirates: Royal Guard Limited Mini Faction
Description:
The Royal Guard is a limited mini faction packed with 2 ship miniatures, 27 Skill Cards, 2 Ship Cards and 2 Captain Cards. This faction adds more variety in the world and gives players the ability to fight with new strategies using their unique skill cards. Welcome aboard, Captain!

"The noble Captains of the Royal Guard were once English aristocrats. They grew tired of the Crown's greedy taxation and began funding their own ventures. The wealth of the Royal Guard attracted many skilled Captains and even better ship builders. All formal factions despise their existence and call them no more than well dressed pirates. They return the hostility in the form of well aimed cannon shots."

—description from the publisher

Name: Party & Texaco
Description: The players are divided into teams. Party & Taxaco has assignments in the following categories: 1 lip reading, 2 facial expressions, gestures and sounds, 3 answer a question correctly, 4 sketches and drawings, 5 forbidden words. Try to complete all mission hats and you are the winner. Complete with manual. Suitable for 3-20 players, ages 8 and up

Name: Marãná
Description:
Marãná is a simple and strategic card game for 2 to 3 people with a focus on battle and inspired by brazilian native american culture. It uses unique positioning mechanics in three rows and four columns for each player. The position of each warrior card is crucial in determining who he can attack. The base game comes with 3 decks of 30 cards each and all cards are unique. In the match setup, you choose 20 of the 30 cards for that match. Each warrior is unique and has Strength and Dodge values that allow these characters to attack, counterattack or dodge in combat, creating an immersive and intense game. Strength or Dodge points earn a bonus from a D4 to increase the variability of combats and make them more real. No warrior is able to return once they have been defeated and the objective of the game is to leave the opponent's field without any card on it, which means instant victory.

—description from the designer
